meanings.definition: To root out and destroy completely.
meanings.sent1: The gardener had to extirpate the stubborn weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were ordered to extirpate all traces of the enemy's presence.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to extirpate the mystery of the missing cookie jar.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to extirpate any doubts from her mind was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire threatened to extirpate the entire forest within hours.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to extirpate the outdated software from their systems.
meanings.sent2: The floodwaters threatened to extirpate the fragile bridge.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to extirpate the burnt bits from the bottom of the pot.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to extirpate the colors from the canvas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury seemed to extirpate all signs of life from the once bustling town.

meanings.sent1: The pest control team worked tirelessly to extirpate the termite infestation.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine was developed to extirpate the deadly virus from spreading further.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to extirpate all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: The new cleaning product promised to extirpate germs and bacteria effectively.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse seemed to extirpate generations of the royal family.
